Linux 2.6 for the Blackfin Processor
The uClinux Distribution for the Analog Devices Blackfin Processor

Release Notes: This release incorporates a complete port of the Linux kernel and the uClinux distribution for the Blackfin processor. It has been tested on a variety of STAMP and EZ-Kit development platforms.

Some feature highlights:
  • Full network support with complete networking stack (TCP/IP) with example services such as telnet, http, ftp, samba, etc...
  • L1 Data/Instruction cache and SRAM
  • CPLB management
  • Priority Driven Interrupt Management
  • The uClibc library
  • Full filesystem support such as EXT2/EXT3/ROMFS/CRAMFS/JFFS2/JFFS2/NFS/SMBFS
For a more complete list, please visit our Documentation Wiki. You can always obtain the latest version of our source releases from the Blackfin Linux website.


For questions, comments, troubles, etc..., please visit our web forums:
http://blackfin.uclinux.org/
